intro: Pimelea curviflora subsp. fusiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical flower spikes that are typically red or orange in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests. It is a member of the family Thymelaeaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The subspecies fusiformis is distinguished by its more elongated and narrower leaves compared to other subspecies of Pimelea curviflora.
